questions.question: Prior to his presidency, how did Abraham Lincoln first become noticed in politics?

choices.answer: During his debate with Douglas, Lincoln performed strongly.
He won the Senate race against Douglas in 1858.
He wrote letters to a newspaper supporting Douglas.
All of these

questions.question: True or False: Abraham Lincoln was the first Republican president in United States history.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Why did many Southerners fear Lincoln after his election?

choices.answer: They thought he would preserve the Confederacy.
They thought he would allow slavery.
They felt their rights and liberties would be taken away.
All of these

questions.question: How did a newly-elected Lincoln disagree with Buchanan after South Carolina's secession?

choices.answer: He believed no state could lawfully secede from the Union.
He believed South Carolina had the right to secede.
He supported slavery in free states.
All of these

questions.question: After the Confederates opened fire on Fort Sumter, how did Lincoln react?

choices.answer: He did not want to start a war so he did nothing.
He called for 75,000 troops to fight for the Union.
He wrote a strongly-worded letter to Governor Pickens.
He wrote about the loss of life at Fort Sumter.

questions.question: What immediate effect did Lincoln's call for troops to fight for the Union have on the U.S.?

choices.answer: Most Northerners opposed Lincoln.
There was no immediate effect.
Virginia, North Carolina, Tennessee, and Arkansas seceded.
Maryland, Kentucky, and Delaware joined the Confederacy.

questions.question: True or False: Lincoln would have dissolved the Union if it meant slavery would come to an end.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.resources: Photo by John-Mark Kuznietsov on Unsplash

questions.question: Why did Lincoln issue the Emancipation Proclamation?

choices.answer: He knew slavery helped the South continue their fight.
Britain and France would be less likely to aid the South.
He supported the Confederates' rights.
He knew that the slavery issue needed to be resolved.

questions.question: When did Lincoln announce his plan to issue the Emancipation Proclamation?

choices.answer: Days before Grant's death
Five days after the Battle of Gettysburg
Five days after the Battle of Antietam
On the anniversary of the start of the war

questions.question: True or False: During the war, Lincoln suspended habeas corpus.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: What was important about Lincoln's Gettysburg Address?

choices.answer: It helped Americans focus on their shared ideals.
It focused on freedom, equality, and national unity.
It was a lengthy speech that focused on punishing the South.
His speech was about the mistakes made by the South.

questions.question: What plan did Lincoln have for accepting the Southern states back into the Union?

choices.answer: Ten Percent Plan
Twenty Percent Plan
The Wade-Davis Bill
The Emancipation Proclamation

questions.question: True or False: Lincoln was assassinated just five days after Lee's army surrendered.

choices.answer: True
False
